intro: Corynotheca micrantha var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender corynotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
